item.title: Israel strikes Gaza school housing displaced, killing dozens
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Mohamad El Chamaa, Hajar Harb, Helier Cheung
item.description: Israel also ordered Palestinians to evacuate from southern areas of Khan Younis, including parts the military previously designated as a safe zone.

item.title: After ‘big show’ in U.S., Netanyahu faces political battles at home
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix
item.description: The prime minster’s inner circle was largely satisfied with the trip — but it might not solve Netanyahu’s cratering popularity among the Israeli electorate.

item.title: How many athletes are in the Paris Olympics, and other key numbers
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Samuel Granados
item.description: The Paris Olympic Games will see about 11,040 athletes take part in 32 sports including athletics, basketball and rowing. Here are the numbers you need to know.

item.title: In Miami, Venezuelan diaspora anxiously watches a vote it can’t participate in
item.dc:creator: Christine Armario
item.description: Many Venezuelans in the United States would like to cast ballots against Nicolás Maduro. But the vast majority won’t be able to vote in what could be a consequential election.

item.title: Netanyahu’s U.S. visit revealed ‘no workable plan’ for peace, critics say
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner, Louisa Loveluck
item.description: A “day after” plan in Gaza is a critical component of President Biden’s vision for peace. Lawmakers say that, for all the effort, it remains a pipe dream.

item.title: U.S., Japan to unveil first steps towards enhanced military alliance
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Michelle Lee
item.description: Biden administration looks to strengthen deterrence against China with a new joint operational command in Japan.

item.title: If Maduro loses, will he cede power? Venezuela’s election, explained.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Ana Herrero
item.description: The opposition is hoping for a victory so overwhelming that the authoritarian socialist will be compelled to negotiate a transition.

item.title: Russia, adapting tactics, advances in Donetsk and takes more Ukrainian land
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Serhii Korolchuk
item.description: The new offensive focus comes as Ukraine faces depleted forces, sweltering heat and turmoil in a potentially consequential U.S. election.

item.title: The Paris Olympics, in comics
item.dc:creator: Robyn Smith
item.description: We asked our favorite cartoonists to watch and live illustrate the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics.

item.title: Olympic Ceremonies on the Seine were a daring feat. Paris stuck the landing.
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Rick Noack
item.description: Paris transformed into a spectacular stage — and demonstrated that bold thinking could bring a shine back to a global event that has seen its popularity slump.

item.title: Mexico wasn’t told of cartel arrests until kingpins were in U.S. custody
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Nick Miroff, David Ovalle
item.description: The capture of Sinaloa cartel leaders Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada and Joaquín Guzmán López was a historic coup against a syndicate that’s flooded the United States with fentanyl.

item.title: Arson attacks target France’s high speed trains hours before Olympics
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Victoria Bisset, Emily Rauhala
item.description: France condemned coordinated “acts of sabotage” on high-speed rail lines, which caused mass disruptions before the Opening Ceremonies of the Paris Olympic Games.

item.title: U.K. ending challenge to ICC arrest warrants for Israeli leaders
item.dc:creator: William Booth
item.description: The withdrawal of its opposition to the arrest warrants puts the new British government at odds with the Biden administration.

item.title: What to know about the Sinaloa cartel after the arrest of ‘El Mayo’
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was a kingpin in Mexico’s Sinaloa cartel, the world’s top producer of fentanyl. He was arrested alongside the son of “El Chapo.”

item.title: From ‘sunny ways’ to cloudy days: Canadians have tired of Justin Trudeau
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: The charismatic son of former Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has won three elections and rescued the Liberal Party from irrelevance. Now voters want change.

item.title: Video of police kicking man on ground at U.K. airport sparks protests
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Video of the incident at Manchester Airport showed an officer kicking a man in the head, leading to accusations of police brutality. The officer has been suspended.

item.title: Russia wary of U.S. and France election surprises, especially Kamala Harris
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton
item.description: Harris, largely unknown to the Russians, is viewed with alarm.

item.title: Olympics quiz: Pick the right anthems, flags and avoid a diplomatic incident
item.dc:creator: Helier Cheung
item.description: Previous Olympics have played the wrong national anthems, or displayed the wrong flags - angering players and supporters. Can you do any better?

item.title: How one Chinese machine tool maker is helping Russia’s war against Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Shibani Mahtani, Pei-Lin Wu
item.description: NATO has accused Beijing of being a “decisive enabler” of Moscow’s ongoing war. The case of Oree Laser, now sanctioned by the U.S., shows how China is helping Russia.

item.title: Top Sinaloa cartel leader taken into U.S. custody alongside son of ‘El Chapo’
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Nick Miroff
item.description: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was fooled into boarding a U.S.-bound private plane with Joaquin Guzmán, El Chapo’s son, who was also detained, a DHS official said.

item.title: Is this the beginning of the end for the Maduro regime in Venezuela?
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: After a decade of economic calamity and political repression, Venezuela stands on the brink of once-unfathomable change: Maduro may lose the presidency by a landslide.

item.title: Harris calls for cease-fire and hostage release after Netanyahu meeting
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager, John Hudson
item.description: The White House is trying to pressure the Israeli prime minister to accept terms of a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.

item.title: How Paris made the city the stage for the 2024 Olympics
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: Instead of building new stadiums, Paris is embedding Olympic events in the French capital and hoping to highlight its history and green transformation.

item.title: New U.K. state company to develop offshore wind on seabed owned by Charles III
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: The Crown Estate, the monarchy’s real estate firm, owns much of the seabed surrounding Britain.
